thread.section_title: NWAonline stories: High School Sports - Northwest Arkansas
thread.title: CLASS 3A

title: CLASS 3A
text:
Posted: October 17, 2015 at 1:51 a.m. 
SUPER SIX 
SMACKOVER 35, FORDYCE 28 
SMACKOVER — Smackover (5-2, 4-0 6-3A) never trailed, holding off Fordyce (4-3, 3-1) on a fourth-and-2 play at the Buckaroos’ 42-yard line midway through the final quarter. 
Fordyce could not do anything on its final possession to secure the Smackover victory. 
Smackover’s Jordan Jones had 3 receptions for 141 yards and 2 touchdowns. The Redbugs were led offensively by Jakeymes Gates who had 238 yards on 27 carries. 
LAMAR 38, CHARLESTON 20 
LAMAR — Two interception returns by Blake Kern helped lead Lamar (7-0, 4-0) past Charleston (4-3, 3-1) in a 4-3A Conference game. 
Lamar led 19-7 at the half. 
Hunter Davenport ran 3 yards for Lamar’s first touchdown and a 7-0 lead in the first quarter. 
After two more Lamar scores in the second quarter, Charleston’s Jackson Rowland passed 22 yards to Sea Flanagan for a touchdown to pull Charleston within 12 at the half. 
Mason Wisdom ran 5 yards for another Charleston touchdown in the third quarter and Flanagan ran for another score in the fourth quarter, but Lamar added touchdowns in each quarter to hold off the Tigers. 
HARDING ACADEMY 56, 
MARIANNA 16 
MARIANNA — Quarterback Alex Francis passed for four touchdowns and Dalton Koch returned a punt and a fumble for touchdowns to lead Harding Academy (6-1, 4-0 2-3A) over Marianna (5-2, 3-1). Francis completed 17 of his 28 attempts for 245 yards. 
Marianna held a brief 8-6 lead in the first on a 56-yard pass form Donte Weems to Jamarcus Arnold. The Marianna score followed Harding Academy’s opening touchdown on a 1-yard Gabe Chapman run. Francis passed 5 yards to Luke Fouts and Koch returned a punt 80 yards for a touchdown for a 19-8 Harding Academy lead. Weems scored for Marianna on a 25-yard run and passed for a two-point conversion to bring Marianna within 19-16. Francis answered for Harding Academy with an 11-yard touchdown pass to Travis Turley to give the Wildcats a 26-16 halftime lead. 
PRESCOTT 56, GLEN ROSE 20 
GLEN ROSE — Trevor Pipkin threw seven touchdown passes for Prescott (5-2, 4-0 5-3A) in a rout of Glen Rose (5-2, 3-1). 
Pipkin opened the scoring on a 27-yard touchdown pass to Kadarius Pearson and followed it with a 78-yard toss to Pearson. Prescott (5-2, 4-0 5-3A) found Dequan Malone on a 54-yard touchdown pass to give the Curly Wolves a 21-7 lead at the end of the first quarter. 
Pipkin threw three more touchdowns in the second quarter, including an 88-yard pass to Brandon Walker. Pipkin ended the night 18 of 26 for 378 yards. 
Glen Rose running back Jordan Johnson ran for 146 yards and 2 touchdowns on 21 carries. 
1-3A 
ELKINS 16, CEDARVILLE 6 
ELKINS — J.J. Miller had 11 tackles and scored on a 38-yard fumble return as the Elks (4-3, 4-0) remained unbeaten in 1-3A Conference play with a victory over Cedarville in a game that was called with less than a minute to play after a fight broke out between the teams. 
GREENLAND 39, MARSHALL 18 
GREENLAND — Cole Self and Alex Sisemore combined for six touchdowns as Greenland (7-0, 4-0 1-3A) defeated Marshall (1-6, 0-4) at Jonathan Ramey Memorial Field. 
Sisemore carried the ball 30 times for 198 yards and 2 touchdowns. Self completed 9 of 14 passes for 141 yards and 3 touchdowns and scored on a 23-yard run. Marshall quarterback Andrew Phillips hit Trey Kelley with a 22-yard touchdown pass, and Kendrick Campbell had a 2-yard touchdown run. 
MOUNTAIN VIEW 32, 
GREEN FOREST 7 
GREEN FOREST — Chris Konkler rushed for 192 yards and 4 touchdowns on 28 carries as Mountain View (3-4, 1-3 1-3A) beat Green Forest (3-4, 2-2). 
Konkler also had an interception on defense. 
Robert Treat had a fumble recovery and Coltin Braswell intercepted a pass for Mountain View. 
Carl Roberts led Green Forest with 56 yards on 14 carries. 
2-3A 
BALD KNOB 35, 
MAYFLOWER 21 
MAYFLOWER — Deshawn Gulledge scored five touchdowns as Bald Knob (4-3, 4-0 2-3A) defeated Mayflower (4-4, 3-2). 
Gulledge had 11 carries for 123 yards and touchdown runs of 41, 3, 15, 71 and 20 yards. He also caught six passes for 76 yards. 
Dominic Harp added 142 yards in 25 carries for Bald Knob, and quarterback Clayton Collins completed 10 of 17 passes for 103 yards and 2 touchdowns. 
5-3A 
CENTERPOINT 35, 
BENTON HARMONY GROVE 26 
AMITY — Centerpoint (5-2, 2-2 5-3A) built a 21-14 lead in first half and didn’t let up against Benton Harmony Grove (5-2, 2-2). 
Quarterback Keenan Owen completed 18 of 25 passes for 254 yards and 3 touchdowns, while running back Deven Horn carried 23 times for 107 and 1 touchdown. Jarrod Graves scored on a 2-yard run. 
EPISCOPAL COLLEGIATE 46, 
JESSIEVILLE 38 
JESSIEVILLE – Kelvin Robinson had 24 carries for 254 yards and 3 touchdowns and returned a kickoff 99 yards for another score as Episcopal Collegiate (6-1, 3-1 5-3A) defeated Jessieville (3-4, 1-3). 
Allie Freeman caught two touchdown passes and rushed for another for the Wildcats. He finished with 6 receptions for 147 yards and had 4 carries for 91 yards. Jessieville was led by Nick Marshall, who had 24 carries for 149 yards and two touchdowns. Steve Benson also scored twice for the Lions. 
HORATIO 49, BISMARCK 0 
HORATIO — Senior fullback Dante Jones rushed for three touchdowns as Horatio (4-3, 1-3 5-3A) beat Bismarck (1-6, 0-4). Junior slotback Alex Martin ran for two scores, while sophomore quarterback Zach Izzo, and sophomore running back Taylor Chavez each added touchdown runs as part of a rushing attack that totaled 356 yards. Jones, who finished with 77 yards rushing, scored on a 1-yard run in the first quarter and added another 1-yard run and a 20-yard run in the third quarter. Martin’s touchdowns came from 10 yards in the first quarter and 4 yards in the second. Izzo scored on a 19-yard run in the second and Chavez’s touchdown came in the fourth. 
(Advertisement)
